results.name: default/wordpress-7bd87b6484-qmfq7
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "wordpress:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check for rate limits on Docker Hub.
5. Try pulling the image manually with `docker pull wordpress:latest`.

results.name: default/mysql-755b79d696-md47f
results.details:
Error: Kubernetes is having trouble pulling the "mysql:latest" image from the container registry.

Solution: 
1. Check internet connectivity.
2. Verify the image name and tag.
3. Ensure Docker Hub is accessible.
4. Check Kubernetes node permissions.
5. Try a specific version tag instead of "latest".

results.name: default/mysql

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/mysql-755b79d696-md47f], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service is not ready because the expected pod is not available.
Solution: 1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`. 2. Inspect pod logs using `kubectl logs mysql-755b79d696-md47f`. 3. Ensure the pod is running and healthy. 4. Verify service and pod labels match. 5. Restart pod if necessary.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has not ready endpoints, pods: [Pod/wordpress-7bd87b6484-qmfq7], expected 1

results.details:
Error: The service doesn't have any ready endpoints because the expected pod is not ready.

Solution: 
1. Check pod status with `kubectl get pods`.
2. Describe pod for issues using `kubectl describe pod wordpress-7bd87b6484-qmfq7`.
3. Resolve any errors found.
4. Verify readiness with `kubectl get endpoints`.
